poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
Grandiloquent, thick squall, you sabred
Scrawl on the biosphere, earth's every small
Trinket a-creak on your stall.
Chatter and dine in clubland; kettle and spall revolt.
They can't spoil a ballot you've already fouled
In electoral shell games
To privatise profit and nationalise debt.
